clinical_study.brief_title: Periacetabular Osteotomy.A Prospective Study With Reference to Cartilage, Migration and Bone Density
clinical_study.official_title: Periacetabular Osteotomy. A Prospective Study With Reference to Cartilage, Migration and Bone Density

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of performing a periacetabular osteotomy on patients with hip dysplasia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within two and a half year

intervention.description: pelvic osteotomy to increase acetabular coverage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with radiologically diagnosed hip dysplasia (CE-angle < 25°)
- Patients with osteoarthritis graded 0, 1 or 2 defined according to Tönnis' classification
- Patients with pain from hip
- Age > 18 years
- Minimum 110° flexion in hip joint and closed growth zones in the pelvic region
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with neurological diseases
- Patients with calvé-Legg-Perthes syndrome
- Patients where a femoral intertrochanteric osteotomy is necessary
- Patients with medical sequelae after earlier hip surgery
- Females who are pregnant
- Patients with metal implants
